channel.title: AWS on Neeraj Sidhaye
channel.description: Recent content in AWS on Neeraj Sidhaye

item.title: AWS Lambda function in GO
item.description: In this post, we will be creating, deploying and invoking a aws lambda function in Go. We will be using AWS CLI throughout this post for Creating role ( aws iam create-role ) Attaching policy to the role ( aws iam attach-role-policy ) Deploying Lambda function ( aws lambda create-function ) Invoking the lambda function ( aws lambda invoke ) Our lambda function will return a account detail json as below.
item.dc:creator: Neeraj Sidhaye

item.title: Deploying GO app docker image on AWS EC2
item.description: In this post, we will be deploying docker image of a GO application on AWS EC2 instance. This involves below steps Launching an EC2 instance SSH to EC2 Installing Docker on EC2 Starting Docker service Pulling image from docker hub Running the docker image on EC2 Testing the application For this post, I have created docker image of a GO rest api and pushed to my docker hub repository.
item.dc:creator: Neeraj Sidhaye
